Intern – Quality Assurance Associate Job at Pearson – 3.7 Providence, RI

Description

PEARSON INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

Intern –Associate Quality Assurance – Global Product – Production & Digital Studio

Pearson Interns – Helping shape the future of education

Why join Pearson’s intern program?

Pearson is the world’s learning company. We help people of all ages acquire the knowledge and skills they need to be successful in their work and careers. We believe that everyone should be able to keep learning, every day and in every way, throughout their lives. Bringing together everything we know about the science of learning and the latest technology, we’re shaping the future of teaching and learning.

We’re looking for the next generation of talented undergraduates to join our team for a 10-week internship. An internship at Pearson is an opportunity to bring your own unique perspective as a learner, together with your academic knowledge, technical skills, and enthusiasm, to help create products used by students like you.

As one of our interns, you will gain a comprehensive introduction to our business. You’ll be assigned to a team and work on real-life projects that bring our products and services to life. On the job training and professional development will be provided to enable you to contribute to the business. You’ll also have direct access to a senior member of the team, as each intern will be mentored to help you make the most of the ten-week program.

We foster a work environment that’s inclusive as well as diverse, where our people can be themselves. Every idea and perspective is valued so that our products reflect the people we serve — our teachers and learners.

What Does the Internship Program Offer?

Successful candidates will spend 10 weeks working within our Production & Digital Studio teams.

You will be paid for the duration of your internship. The internship begins on Monday, June 7th and ends Friday, August 13th.

Title: Intern: Quality Control Analytical Technology
Required Qualifications:
Job Description

This is for a 12-week internship position from June – August 2021.

The individual will perform analytical method development and optimization for antisense oligonucleotide (ASO) medicines in the Quality Control Laboratory.

Potential Areas Of Investigation Include
Method development for ultraviolet (UV) melting temperature (Tm) analysis of complementary oligonucleotide sequences
Development Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) methods for small molecule ID testing.
Evaluation of instrument control and data analysis software programs for increasing efficiency in data analysis and custom calculations in a QC environment.
The intern will learn industry-leading analytical technologies, problem-solving strategies, pharmaceutical product development, and scientific communication. Responsibilities include data generation and analysis, experimental design, report writing and reviewing, and delivering internal scientific presentations.

Qualifications

To participate in the Biogen Internship Program, students must meet the following eligibility criteria:
Legal authorization to work in the U.S.
Grade point average of 3.2 or higher preferred
At least 18 years of age prior to the scheduled start date
Be currently enrolled in an accredited college or university
Coursework in Chemistry (organic and/or analytical), Biochemistry or Chemical Engineering preferred.
Fast learner with scientific curiosity, attention to detail, strong work ethic and works well on a team.
Education

Physical or life sciences major. Undergraduate research or work experience is preferred. Graduate student (MS, Ph.D., Pharm.D., or equivalent), or rising 3rd or 4th year undergraduate.

Location

Research Triangle Park, NC

Relocation not offered for this position.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Quality Assurance Intern
Required Qualifications:
Our Company

Trimble Transportation is in business for optimizing the movement of freight by providing shippers and carriers both mobility, enterprise and visibility software tools they need to run their businesses more efficiently. As the leading provider of Transportation Management Software (TMS), Asset Management Software (AMS), and Fleet Management Software (FMS) we are devoted to propelling companies in the trucking industry toward increased efficiency, lower costs and optimize operations.

Position Overview

An intern will have the opportunity to gain experience with helping build a repository of API, Database and Security testing of our applications including exploration and use of various testing tools to support this type of testing. An intern provides a fresh viewpoint and new ideas to quality implementation of our products. It also allows Trimble to have early influence in instilling solid quality principles in potential future employees.

Primary Responsibilities

Work cross-functionally with key parties from product and development teams to evaluate key system problems, impact from feature releases, and understand potential bottlenecks in our software delivery lifecycle (SDLC)
Attend Daily Scrum meetings to identify what QA is needed to deliver quality product and users experiences in a timely manner
Design new tools and maintain an existing suite of toolsets, integrate them with various systems through collaboration with engineering teams
Design new automated tests and procedures - expanding existing test suites
Maintain and expand existing set of performance test suites
Execute performance test suites and analyze performance results
Setup performance monitoring and identify resource contentions
Effectively analyze, communicate and confirm the resolution of defects
Maintaining various test environments

Required Skills

Familiar with GIT or similar source control tools
Excellent analytical skills
Experience developing in various programming languages (JavaScript, C#, Java, etc)
Currently working towards a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent engineering field
Must be able to work well in a fast-paced environment and quickly shift priorities
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Familiarity with relational databases and basic database maintenance

Preferred Skills

Knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
Experience with continuous integration servers (such as Jenkins/TeamCity)
Experience using software automation testing tools such as Ranorex, TestComplete, QTP, Cypress, Playwright, SpecFlow, Appium, Selenium, SoapUI, and Postman
Experience using software performance testing tools such as LoadRunner, Jmeter, Neoload, Gatling
Experience using basic performance monitoring tools such as Perfmon, SQL Profiler, OEM

Title: Quality Assurance Intern
Required Qualifications:
Quality Assurance Intern

US - Remote
WEX Inc. (NYSE: WEX) provides B2B payment processing and information management solutions. From our roots in fleet card payments beginning in 1983, we have expanded the scope of our business to a multi-channel provider of corporate payment solutions in fleet, virtual travel, and healthcare markets.

Our innovative technology, payment, and data solutions are working to enable our customers and business partners to focus on what they do best: achieve their business growth objectives.

WEX is more than just a corporate payment processing company and a job. We are an agile and innovative technology community, where our curious and collaborative people look to bring the future of commerce to the present.

Our Program

The WEX Internship Program offers a robust experience for ambitious and curious students, who are interested in growing professionally and developing their skills to become the next generation of technology leaders.

Our internship program is designed to provide interns hands-on, practical experiences while working alongside some of our industry’s smartest teams; as well as providing immediate value to their teams and our leaders.

As an intern, you will be challenged and offered the opportunity to make an impact across the business and be involved in the company’s most critical business decisions. *This is a remote position*

What You Will Be Doing In This Role
Learn and create test automation scripts with Python, Go, Java or C#, Cucumber and Selenium.
Reading/understanding specific business processes and user requirements to gain knowledge of a business operation and how users use the application on a daily basis. From that, devising testing scenarios for positive and negative conditions.
Executing test cases to test functionality and to identify any anomalies. Documenting and reporting those defects in JIRA.
Meetings with the development teams to understand how defects are resolved and then retesting the fix.
Writing a formal test plan, including test objectives, prerequisites, test steps, and expected results.
Participating in and helping with other SQA tasks as necessary.


You Should Also Expect
A collaborative and challenging working environment
The opportunity to engage with various stakeholders across the business and senior leadership teams
To train and develop your skills in your area of work with some of the best experts in the payment industry


Who We Are Looking For
At a minimum, you should be a rising junior, senior, OR masters-level student, in a degree/certificate-seeking accredited program
Experience using Python, Go, Java or C#
Familiarity with AWS basics
Familiarity with automation framework basics
Strong project management skills, including planning and execution
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, leadership and communication skills
Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment
Experience with Microservices and/or Application Programming Interface (API's) - preferred
Experience with Performance testing using Locust, Other tools etc - preferred
Experience with Docker - preferred

Required Qualifications:
Intern - Quality Assurance Associate - ( 2105067 )

Description

PEARSON INTERNSHIP PROGRAM

Intern –Associate Quality Assurance – Global Product - Production & Digital Studio

Pearson Interns - Helping shape the future of education

Why join Pearson’s intern program?

Pearson is the world’s learning company. We help people of all ages acquire the knowledge and skills they need to be successful in their work and careers. We believe that everyone should be able to keep learning, every day and in every way, throughout their lives. Bringing together everything we know about the science of learning and the latest technology, we’re shaping the future of teaching and learning.

We’re looking for the next generation of talented undergraduates to join our team for a 10-week internship. An internship at Pearson is an opportunity to bring your own unique perspective as a learner, together with your academic knowledge, technical skills, and enthusiasm, to help create products used by students like you.

As one of our interns, you will gain a comprehensive introduction to our business. You’ll be assigned to a team and work on real-life projects that bring our products and services to life. On the job training and professional development will be provided to enable you to contribute to the business. You’ll also have direct access to a senior member of the team, as each intern will be mentored to help you make the most of the ten-week program.

We foster a work environment that’s inclusive as well as diverse, where our people can be themselves. Every idea and perspective is valued so that our products reflect the people we serve — our teachers and learners.

What Does the Internship Program Offer?

Successful candidates will spend 10 weeks working within our Production & Digital Studio teams.

You will be paid for the duration of your internship. The internship begins on Monday, June 7th and ends Friday, August 13th.

Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Record Production and vendor problems and concerns in an established tracking system.

Title: Food Quality Assurance Intern
Required Qualifications:
We’re bringing an egg white to the table that is produced completely animal-free using fermentation technology, uses less land and water inputs, while matching the taste, nutritional value, and unique culinary properties of hen-borne egg whites.

Ideal Start Date: May 24th, 2021

Duration of Internship: 6 - 8 months (up to 40 hours per week)

Location: South San Francisco, CA
Hiring Manager: Associate Director, Quality and Regulatory Affairs

Job Code: RQ-100

Internship Responsibilities

Under active supervision,

You will run experiments to determine the functionality of the proteins using established procedures, recording data meticulously and analyzing the data.
Assist with preparing Quality Control Reports, ingredient validation and inventory management.
You will participate in exploring ideas to improve the quality of the product offerings including new idea generation, experimental design and execution of experiments.
You will collaborate with cross functional teams comprising of technical experts within the R&D function as required.

Qualifications/Requirements We Are Looking For

BS or MS in Food Science, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Nutrition, Agriculture or related degree.
Ability to contribute in a fast paced, research-oriented environment.
Basic knowledge of food chemistry, ingredient technology, food processing and analytical techniques used in the food industry is desirable.
Candidates must be in good academic standing with a 3.0 GPA or higher.
Operate with moderate supervision and have meticulous attention to detail.
Experience with literature research and design of experiments is desirable.
Intermediate knowledge of computer skills including Microsoft Word and Excel and working with Google Drive is required.
Proven ability to manage multiple assignments/ tasks.
Strong communication skills (oral and written).
Must be authorized to work in the United States for Clara Foods.

What We Can Offer

Paid internship
Ample opportunities to apply analytical and critical thinking skills in the food industry.
An engaging and fulfilling way to use science to make an impact in shaping Clara’s breakthrough product offerings
Opportunity to contribute to cutting edge research in a great team environment.

Additional Perks!
Unlimited supply of sparkling water, granola bars, local coffees, and teas
Monthly all-hands meetings; and cross-functional training opportunities
Company merch, IT support, and company-provided electronic equipment
Free parking, renovated gym, lounge/patio area, yoga + cycling classes onsite
Weekly virtual happy hours
Close to South San Francisco bart station and Cal Train station (Shuttles run directly from our building to these stations)

About Clara Foods™

Clara Foods™ is a Bay Area venture capital-backed company working towards a disruptive advance in food technology by producing animal proteins without the animal using fermentation. We join a new generation of entrepreneurs, activists and scientists who recognize that the decades-old factory farm model cannot sustain the dietary needs of 7 billion people and counting - and that technology may hold a solution.

As much as the growing market demands for animal protein production exert pressure on food producers to improve their efficiencies and outputs, there is also growing public distaste for the environmental, animal welfare, and health compromises of industrial-scale animal agriculture.

Clara Foods™ aims to subvert this moral and economic deadlock by taking the animal out of the equation. We’re bringing products to the table that are produced completely animal-free, use less land and water inputs, while matching the taste, nutritional value, and unique culinary properties of animal proteins.

Title: Quality Assurance Internship
Required Qualifications:
Quality Assurance Intern, $13/hour, remote optional

Diverse Computing -- a local law enforcement technology company known for being an industry leader in customer support and intuitive software design -- is looking for a Quality Assurance Intern to join our team. This internship could either start immediately or during the upcoming summer 2021 semester. This internship will be remote only, but there is the option to work at our corporate headquarters located in Tallahassee, FL, once Covid restrictions are lifted. This internship would carry over for a minimum of 2-3 consecutive semesters with the opportunity for full-time employment after graduation. Ideally, we're looking for a student who would be graduating fall 2021, spring 2022, or later.

Working at Diverse Computing is different from most places; you’re not going to feel the “grind” here like you would at a typical internship. That’s because we offer a dynamic work atmosphere where we welcome creative ideas, collaboration, and flexibility. You’ll be working on projects that have a measurable impact on public safety, all while gaining real-world experience.

The ideal candidate for this internship would be someone who loves to analyze software test plans, is highly organized, and has meticulous attention to detail. In this internship, you’ll help the project management and development teams test actual software and design real testing strategies. If you’re a self-motivated worker who is ready for a challenge, this could be the ideal internship for you! Please read on for more info.

As the QA Intern you will
Develop, maintain, and implement integration testing strategies and scenarios
Assist in preparation for User Acceptance Training (UAT)
Communicate with business/systems analysts and developers to understand system requirements
Identify and report issues in a bug tracking system
Provide status reports and regular updates to the project manager
Maintain testing documentation for your projects
Participate in production support and troubleshooting when required


Requirements

This job might be for you if
You have a fundamental understanding of IT, database, and software development concepts
You frequently use MS Office and/or Google Docs applications
You have phenomenal attention-to-detail
Written and oral communication is your strong suit
“Organized” is your middle name (perhaps literally)
A strong work ethic is part of who you are
You have a naturally analytical mind
You go over all of your work with a fine-tooth comb, every time, because you always want to do your best
You have a strong imagination and can effectively envision real business situations
You’re currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology (IT); Management Information Systems (MIS); Information, Communication, and Technology (ICT); Computer Science (CS); Editing, Writing, and Media (EWM); or other related technology or communication fields
You are graduating this Fall 2021 or later


All applicants must
Have availability to work for a minimum of 15-20 hours/week
Be able to commit to a multi-semester internship
Pass a background check and drug screening


Benefits

We ask a lot, but we give a lot in return
We offer schedules that are flexible with your classes and school activities.
If you’re the right candidate, we’ll consider you for a full-time position at the conclusion of your internship.
We have an award-winning office culture that’s welcoming, fun, and collaborative. We’ve been recognized as one of the country’s best places to work and one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S.
You’ll get to work on projects that help improve public safety.
You’ll have opportunities to get involved with local young professional groups, charity work, and further professional training if desired.
Working for a small but growing company means lots of chances for horizontal and vertical movement within our ranks.


Ready to apply?
Find more information about working at Diverse Computing on our website, diversecomputing.com/careers.
Click on the application link below and apply. Be sure to provide a cover letter that includes contact info for three professional references.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Quality Control Microbiology Intern
Required Qualifications:
Overview

GENERAL SUMMARY OF POSITION:

In this role you will be assisting our Quality Control Microbiology group with one or more activities related to environmental monitoring, water testing, and product support for vaccines and/or therapeutic monoclonal antibodies. You will gain experience of working in a GMP regulated environment and will learn how the environment in which a product is manufactured contributes to the overall product quality as regulated by the FDA to ensure that safe and effective vaccines and biologics are produced

Responsibilities

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct regular laboratory housekeeping duties such as autoclaving, maintaining lab cleanliness and supply inventory.
Prepare reagents, buffers and disinfectants.
Assist with lab administrative tasks such as data entry and archiving documents.
Sample collection and preparation and testing according to SOPs, collecting and analyzing data, documenting results on in-process assay forms and/or LIMS system
You will obtain hands on training with techniques that are widely used in biopharmaceutical industry, such as:
Environmental monitoring, water testing, bioburden testing, endotoxin testing, TOC and Chemistry Testing
cGLP (current Good Laboratory Practice) and cGMP (current Good Manufacturing Practice), LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System)
Data analysis and trending

Qualifications

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in progress or Technical Training certificate or Associate’s degree in Biology, Biotechnology, or related discipline. Knowledge of basic microbiology is preferred.
Hands on experience in a biology or microbiology laboratory. Ability to use a micropipette, and use aseptic technique in a sterile lab environment.
Ability to be responsible for conducting routine laboratory tasks that are critical to successful department operation.
Excellent written documentation and laboratory organizing skills. Ability to follow oral and written procedures precisely.

Additional Information

Resident of one of the following zip codes are preferred: 02118, 02119, 02120, 02121, 02122, 02124, 02125, 02130, 02126, 02131, 02136, 02137. (These zip codes cover Dorchester, Roxbury, Jamaica Plain, Hyde Park, Roslindale and Mattapan, MA.)

Title: Quality Assurance Intern

WEX Inc. (NYSE: WEX) provides B2B payment processing and information management solutions. From our roots in fleet card payments beginning in 1983, we have expanded the scope of our business to a multi-channel provider of corporate payment solutions in fleet, virtual travel, and healthcare markets.

Our innovative technology, payment, and data solutions are working to enable our customers and business partners to focus on what they do best: achieve their business growth objectives.
WEX is more than just a corporate payment processing company and a job. We are an agile and innovative technology community, where our curious and collaborative people look to bring the future of commerce to the present.
• *OUR PROGRAM**:

The WEX Internship Program offers a robust experience for ambitious and curious students, who are interested in growing professionally and developing their skills to become the next generation of technology leaders.
Our internship program is designed to provide interns hands-on, practical experiences while working alongside some of our industry's smartest teams; as well as providing immediate value to their teams and our leaders.

- Learn and create test automation scripts with Python, Go, Java or C#, Cucumber and Selenium.
- Reading/understanding specific business processes and user requirements to gain knowledge of a business operation and how users use the application on a daily basis. From that, devising testing scenarios for positive and negative conditions.
- Executing test cases to test functionality and to identify any anomalies. Documenting and reporting those defects in JIRA.
- Meetings with the development teams to understand how defects are resolved and then retesting the fix.
- Writing a formal test plan, including test objectives, prerequisites, test steps, and expected results.
- Participating in and helping with other SQA tasks as necessary.
• *YOU SHOULD ALSO EXPECT**:

- A collaborative and challenging working environment
- The opportunity to engage with various stakeholders across the business and senior leadership teams
- To train and develop your skills in your area of work with some of the best experts in the payment industry

Title: GxP Systems QA Intern
Required Qualifications:
BeiGene continues to grow at a rapid pace with challenging and exciting opportunities for experienced professionals. When considering candidates, we look for scientific and business professionals who are highly motivated, collaborative, and most importantly, share our passionate interest in fighting cancer.
General Description/Scope Of Responsibilities (Internship)
We are looking for a dynamic, energetic intern who is eager to learn about our company by assisting various projects in the validation QA group. You will be working closely with our team to conduct research, capture data and attend meetings where you will be asked to take minutes.
The Intern will work on conducting research on paperless validation tool. Maturing paperless validation capability is a key goal for Beigene validation QA group. The Intern will look at potential options available in the market for this tool, write detailed document listing differences in functionality between available tools from a technical perspective.
The organization wants to implement Paperless validation which would be cost beneficial and highly customizable and bring in efficiency within the organization. To be successful as an Intern, you should be willing to help with any tasks assigned by a supervisor.
Essential Functions of the Internship: Other duties may be assigned.
Fulfill tasks set out by supervisor from Validation QA group.
Attend meetings and take minutes.
Perform research on paperless validation tools.
Understand from the validation team the key need for Paperless Validation.
Categorize and Catalogue the business process for Paperless Validation with help from other members of the organization.
Perform a strategic vendor selection for Paperless validation with help from other members of the organization.
Education Required
Must be actively enrolled in a university (entering junior year or above preferred; with a 3.0 GPA).
Computer Skills: Efficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
Other Qualifications
Enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate degree program. (Business Administration, Data Analytics, Statistics, Management Information Systems or equivalent)
Computer proficiency: G-Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides)
Good Understanding of basics of computer systems and how they can be used to gain efficiency.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills combined with strong business judgment and an ability to present analysis in a clear and compelling manner.
Highly self-motivated and detail-oriented
Competencies
Ethics - Treats people with respect; Works with integrity and ethically; Upholds organizational values.
Communication - Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations.
Teamwork - Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit.
Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and development areas; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.
Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.
Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully.

Sloan is the world’s leading manufacturer of commercial plumbing systems and has been in operation since 1906. We are at the forefront of the green building movement and provide sustainable restroom solutions. We manufacture water-efficient products including flush valves, electronic faucets, soap dispensing and sink systems along with vitreous china fixtures for commercial, industrial and institutional markets worldwide.

We are hiring a Quality Assurance Intern in our Franklin Park, IL headquarters beginning in June through August of this year. The Quality Assurance Intern will assist and learn the day to day activities in the Quality Assurance Department. Experienced with Microsoft office and Minitab
